programs.name: M.Tech in Design
programs.full_name: M.Tech in Design - Design at Asterion Institute of Technology
programs.description: M.Tech in Design - Design at Asterion Institute of Technology is a rigorous, industry-aligned program at Asterion Institute of Technology. It blends foundational theory with hands-on labs, internships, and a capstone, preparing students for high-impact roles in Design across startups, enterprises, and research labs.
programs.detailed_description: The curriculum emphasizes strong fundamentals (mathematics, programming, and systems) and modern design topics such as emerging tools, ethical and responsible technology, and domain electives. Students engage in hackathons, research seminars, and collaborative studio courses. Career services provide mock interviews, resume reviews, and alumni networking. Graduates enter roles including Design Engineer, Researcher, Consultant.

programs.description: M.Tech in Business Analytics - Business Analytics at Asterion Institute of Technology is a rigorous, industry-aligned program at Asterion Institute of Technology. It blends foundational theory with hands-on labs, internships, and a capstone, preparing students for high-impact roles in Business Analytics across startups, enterprises, and research labs.
programs.detailed_description: The curriculum emphasizes strong fundamentals (mathematics, programming, and systems) and modern business analytics topics such as emerging tools, ethical and responsible technology, and domain electives. Students engage in hackathons, research seminars, and collaborative studio courses. Career services provide mock interviews, resume reviews, and alumni networking. Graduates enter roles including Business Analytics Engineer, Researcher, Consultant.

eligibility.summary: 10+2 with relevant subjects or equivalent as per university policy
detailed_requirements: Completed 10+2 or equivalent with relevant subjects
Minimum aggregate marks as per category cutoff
Entrance exam score may be considered

common_questions: What is the eligibility for M.Tech in Business Analytics?
How much does M.Tech in Business Analytics cost?

courses.title: Natural Language Processing: Advanced Concepts
courses.description: A advanced level course on Natural Language Processing.
courses.detailed_description: This course offers a comprehensive treatment of natural language processing, combining theory, coding labs, and a mini-project. Weekly modules progress from foundations to applied case studies. Students receive scaffolded feedback through assignments and studio sessions.
learning_outcomes: Explain key principles of natural language processing and situate them within real-world contexts.
Design and implement solutions using natural language processing methods and standard libraries.
Evaluate models/solutions with appropriate metrics and communicate trade-offs.
Work effectively in teams using version control and peer review practices.
Demonstrate ethical and responsible use of technology in natural language processing applications.
textbooks: Foundations of Data Science by Avrim Blum
Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning by Bishop
syllabus_outline: Module 5: Model evaluation, error analysis, and iteration
Module 7: Ethics, fairness, privacy, and security

textbooks: Foundations of Data Science by Avrim Blum

learning_outcomes: Explain key principles of ethics in technology and situate them within real-world contexts.
Design and implement solutions using ethics in technology methods and standard libraries.
Evaluate models/solutions with appropriate metrics and communicate trade-offs.
Work effectively in teams using version control and peer review practices.
Demonstrate ethical and responsible use of technology in ethics in technology applications.
textbooks: Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning by Bishop
Introduction to Algorithms by Cormen et al.
syllabus_outline: Module 5: Model evaluation, error analysis, and iteration
Module 7: Ethics, fairness, privacy, and security

textbooks: Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning by Bishop
Introduction to Algorithms by Cormen et al.

courses.description: A advanced level course on Operating Systems.
courses.detailed_description: This course offers a comprehensive treatment of operating systems, combining theory, coding labs, and a mini-project. Weekly modules progress from foundations to applied case studies. Students receive scaffolded feedback through assignments and studio sessions.
learning_outcomes: Explain key principles of operating systems and situate them within real-world contexts.
Design and implement solutions using operating systems methods and standard libraries.
Evaluate models/solutions with appropriate metrics and communicate trade-offs.
Work effectively in teams using version control and peer review practices.
Demonstrate ethical and responsible use of technology in operating systems applications.

courses.detailed_description: This course offers a comprehensive treatment of signal processing, combining theory, coding labs, and a mini-project. Weekly modules progress from foundations to applied case studies. Students receive scaffolded feedback through assignments and studio sessions.
learning_outcomes: Explain key principles of signal processing and situate them within real-world contexts.
Design and implement solutions using signal processing methods and standard libraries.
Evaluate models/solutions with appropriate metrics and communicate trade-offs.
Work effectively in teams using version control and peer review practices.
Demonstrate ethical and responsible use of technology in signal processing applications.
textbooks: Computer Networks by Tanenbaum
Operating Systems by Silberschatz
syllabus_outline: Module 5: Model evaluation, error analysis, and iteration
Module 7: Ethics, fairness, privacy, and security

courses.title: Operating Systems: Intermediate Concepts
courses.description: A intermediate level course on Operating Systems.
courses.detailed_description: This course offers a comprehensive treatment of operating systems, combining theory, coding labs, and a mini-project. Weekly modules progress from foundations to applied case studies. Students receive scaffolded feedback through assignments and studio sessions.
learning_outcomes: Explain key principles of operating systems and situate them within real-world contexts.
Design and implement solutions using operating systems methods and standard libraries.
Evaluate models/solutions with appropriate metrics and communicate trade-offs.
Work effectively in teams using version control and peer review practices.
Demonstrate ethical and responsible use of technology in operating systems applications.

courses.detailed_description: This course offers a comprehensive treatment of linear algebra, combining theory, coding labs, and a mini-project. Weekly modules progress from foundations to applied case studies. Students receive scaffolded feedback through assignments and studio sessions.
learning_outcomes: Explain key principles of linear algebra and situate them within real-world contexts.
Design and implement solutions using linear algebra methods and standard libraries.
Evaluate models/solutions with appropriate metrics and communicate trade-offs.
Work effectively in teams using version control and peer review practices.
Demonstrate ethical and responsible use of technology in linear algebra applications.
textbooks: Foundations of Data Science by Avrim Blum
Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning by Bishop
syllabus_outline: Module 5: Model evaluation, error analysis, and iteration
Module 7: Ethics, fairness, privacy, and security

learning_outcomes: Explain key principles of computer networks and situate them within real-world contexts.
Design and implement solutions using computer networks methods and standard libraries.
Evaluate models/solutions with appropriate metrics and communicate trade-offs.
Work effectively in teams using version control and peer review practices.
Demonstrate ethical and responsible use of technology in computer networks applications.

courses.description: A introductory level course on Optimization.
courses.detailed_description: This course offers a comprehensive treatment of optimization, combining theory, coding labs, and a mini-project. Weekly modules progress from foundations to applied case studies. Students receive scaffolded feedback through assignments and studio sessions.
learning_outcomes: Explain key principles of optimization and situate them within real-world contexts.
Design and implement solutions using optimization methods and standard libraries.
Evaluate models/solutions with appropriate metrics and communicate trade-offs.
Work effectively in teams using version control and peer review practices.
Demonstrate ethical and responsible use of technology in optimization applications.

courses.description: A elective level course on Thermodynamics.
courses.detailed_description: This course offers a comprehensive treatment of thermodynamics, combining theory, coding labs, and a mini-project. Weekly modules progress from foundations to applied case studies. Students receive scaffolded feedback through assignments and studio sessions.
learning_outcomes: Explain key principles of thermodynamics and situate them within real-world contexts.
Design and implement solutions using thermodynamics methods and standard libraries.
Evaluate models/solutions with appropriate metrics and communicate trade-offs.
Work effectively in teams using version control and peer review practices.
Demonstrate ethical and responsible use of technology in thermodynamics applications.

courses.detailed_description: This course offers a comprehensive treatment of discrete mathematics, combining theory, coding labs, and a mini-project. Weekly modules progress from foundations to applied case studies. Students receive scaffolded feedback through assignments and studio sessions.
learning_outcomes: Explain key principles of discrete mathematics and situate them within real-world contexts.
Design and implement solutions using discrete mathematics methods and standard libraries.
Evaluate models/solutions with appropriate metrics and communicate trade-offs.
Work effectively in teams using version control and peer review practices.
Demonstrate ethical and responsible use of technology in discrete mathematics applications.
textbooks: Operating Systems by Silberschatz
Introduction to Algorithms by Cormen et al.
syllabus_outline: Module 5: Model evaluation, error analysis, and iteration
Module 7: Ethics, fairness, privacy, and security

courses.title: Robotics: Intermediate Concepts
courses.description: A intermediate level course on Robotics.
courses.detailed_description: This course offers a comprehensive treatment of robotics, combining theory, coding labs, and a mini-project. Weekly modules progress from foundations to applied case studies. Students receive scaffolded feedback through assignments and studio sessions.
learning_outcomes: Explain key principles of robotics and situate them within real-world contexts.
Design and implement solutions using robotics methods and standard libraries.
Evaluate models/solutions with appropriate metrics and communicate trade-offs.
Work effectively in teams using version control and peer review practices.
Demonstrate ethical and responsible use of technology in robotics applications.
